intro: Dilkea hebes, commonly known as the New Zealand hebe, is a genus of flowering plants native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plants typically have aromatic leaves and can vary in height from shrubs to small trees. They are often found in coastal and alpine regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Dilkea hebes are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to attract native pollinators.
